so let's get started the first thing

turned into a surprise pinata so carve

normally would and then you want to take
a circle cutter so I will leave

I like to push these down on top because

just like to cut the very very top of
the point off before adding that ganache
as a bit of a crumb coat just like we
would for a normal giant cupcake if
you've got any questions about the

but we're just going to make a couple of

you just want to push down into your

that's just going to give them time to

a bit of structure in a bit of shape

going to be to make sure there's no

our top we want to make a tiled effect
so you want to squeeze out and as you
squeeze out you also are flattening off
so essentially you're squeezing out like

using that technique all the way around
the cupcake and when you come to the top
you're just going to need to do a couple

into the center you want to take your

of cornflour
roll that purple fondant out really nice
and thin use your pizza cutter to cut
just a bit of a rectangle shape and
we're just going to measure it up the

off one side of it this is going to make

just plain tap water on the back and
then position it up against your giant

to kind of cut a couple of Cathedral

down on the piece of fondant and use

they're both the same once more a little

your chocolate should be set so when you

Cathedral windows so I've done four

for cathedral windows so that we've got

once you've completed all four of those
you stick the turrets on by simply

if you can't find those pink lifesavers
here's a roll of white ones that

as thin as you possibly can cut it into
a couple of sort of big chunky
rectangles sort of shapes and there's no

fold that like an accordion so flip it
over fold one side towards you and then
turn the whole piece and fold it back
repeat that process you've got three or
four folds now you just want to use your
fingers just to kind of spread out a
little bit but don't worry if it's not
too neat here and then just kind of kink
it into a bit of a semicircle you're
going to need about five or six of those
to go all the way around this cake once
you've got them done you want to just

to use a little bit of that melted

off you actually want to use chocolate
to a fix it to that chocolate cupcake
case like so start in the middle of the
door for your first two drapes so that
your first two drapes meet perfectly in
the center of the front of your cupcake
and then you can go around on either
side because if you're going to have any

at the back once you've got all of your
drapes applied you can take some of
those flowers which should be kind of
set by now a little bit of chocolate on

between the little joins of the drapes
so you couldn't see where they joined
your castle should be looking something
like this it's time to insert those
turrets so as I push these in I'm kind
of twisting them with my fingers be
really gentle that melted chocolate is
going to hold them together but you
don't want to break them I did one
turret in the middle two shorter turrets
on either side and one very short turret
right at the front for final detail I
just put a line of plain water around

to completely line the door and the two

bling a bit of detail my castle was
still missing a little something so I
